column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Cook Without Teflon
#Text=Teflon is a registered trademark and brand name of the DuPont company for products made from fluorine-containing polymers ( fluoropolymers ) .
#Text=Other companies also use similar coatings for their non-stick cookware .
#Text=These products are created using chemicals that are known to be toxic .
#Text=Although the manufacturers will tell you that they do not release chemicals " under normal conditions " , even they admit that overheating can cause these dangerous chemicals to gas off .
#Text=At this time there are no studies that prove that fluoropolymers are dangerous , that is not a guarantee of their safety .
#Text=By following the advice in this article you can at least reduce your families risk of exposure to these chemicals .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Research the possible effects of fluoropolymers , and make an educated decision .

#Text=Although studies to date do not indicate a measurable risk , there are broader studies that show that the combination of many small doses of a variety of chemicals can combine to have serious health effects .
#Text=It is up to you to decide whether you need to take the risk with your family 's health .
#Text=Use oven-proof glassware .
#Text=Glassware is a safe natural alternative for use in the oven .
#Text=Heat resistant glass can be used for baking and roasting .
#Text=Whether you are cooking up a loaf of bread or roasting a chicken , there is excellent glass cookware to meet your needs .
#Text=Glass is in practical terms as non stick as Teflon under normal use .
#Text=Use a cast iron pan for frying .
#Text=Cast iron , when used properly builds up a natural " patina " which is not only non-stick , but also fairly resistant to the use of metal implements .
#Text=Use a steel wok for Asian foods ( stir-fries , curries , etc ) .
#Text=Like cast iron , a steel wok when used properly builds up a natural " patina " .
#Text=Use silicone for baking cakes , muffins and pies .
#Text=Silicon cookware is something fairly new .
#Text=It is a non-chemical product and virtually non-stick .
#Text=If in doubt , use stainless steel pots and pans .
#Text=Stainless steel can be close to non-stick unless overheated .
#Text=If you do scorch the pan you 're going to have some scrubbing to do , but a bit of scrubbing is better than gassing your family with nasty fluorine compounds !
#Text=Tips
#Text=Clean your cast iron pans using a nylon dish-brush and no soap .
#Text=Scrub away any food scraps , and then stick them back on the flame ( or element ) for a minute to evaporate any water .
#Text=Glassware usually cleans up easily , but if you get something really baked on it will much easier to clean after soaking overnight .
#Text=Although silicone is reasonably non-stick , it is a good idea to grease the pan or tray with a little butter - just to be sure .
#Text=Silicone pans and trays are floppy !
#Text=Use two hands when moving to and from the oven .
#Text=If you do a lot of Asian cooking , you might want two woks .
#Text=One for wet ( e.g. Thai curry ) and one for dry ( e.g. Stir fry ) .
#Text=In both cases , treat them similarly to cast iron ( clean without soap and dry on element ) .
#Text=They will also build up a patina - this is good !
#Text=The dry one will usually end up blacker ( even better ) , but if you then use it for a wet curry or soup you might get black bits in your meal .
#Text=Still at least it 's just carbon and not some nasty fluorine compound !
#Text=Soak scorched stainless steel pots and pans , and then clean using baking soda ( and a lot of elbow grease ) .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Cast iron pans that have not yet built up a patina can leach small amounts of iron into acidic foods like tomato sauces .
#Text=Iron is a vital nutrient , but for some people excess iron can be a problem .
#Text=If you suffer from haemochromatosis or similar conditions you may want to avoid cooking in cast iron .
#Text=If in doubt , check with your physician .
#Text=If you have a pet bird , and continue to use Teflon , be extra careful not to overheat the pan .
#Text=Even small doses of the chemicals that gas off will kill a bird .
#Text=( Consider this , and the reason why miners used to take a canary with them ) .
